articles.headline: Impeach Trump or Work With Him? Democrats Are Pushing Forward on Both
articles.snippet: On the day Democrats formally charged President Trump with high crimes and misdemeanors, Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she would cut a deal with him on trade.
articles.abstract: On the day Democrats formally charged President Trump with high crimes and misdemeanors, Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she would cut a deal with him on trade.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — On the day that House Democrats formally accused President Trump of high crimes and misdemeanors, something unusual happened in the capital: Divided government actually started to work.

articles.headline: Aung San Suu Kyi Defends Myanmar Against Rohingya Genocide Accusations
articles.snippet: After hearing a roll call of horrors inflicted on Rohingya Muslims, the Nobel laureate explained Myanmar’s case in The Hague.
articles.abstract: After hearing a roll call of horrors inflicted on Rohingya Muslims, the Nobel laureate explained Myanmar’s case in The Hague.
articles.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE — “Intercommunal violence.” Action against “insurgents or terrorists.” Possible — only possible — use of “disproportionate force.” But not genocide.
articles.byline: By Marlise Simons and Hannah Beech

articles.headline: Who Keeps Europe’s Farm Billions Flowing? Often, Those Who Benefit
articles.snippet: Conflict-of-interest rules are uneven. Influence-peddling is murky.  The enormous E.U. subsidy program is built to keep the money moving.
articles.abstract: Conflict-of-interest rules are uneven. Influence-peddling is murky.  The enormous E.U. subsidy program is built to keep the money moving.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — One morning this spring, lawmakers crowded into a committee room filled with staffers, lobbyists and environmentalists to vote on a flurry of bills that would set the course for the European Union’s $65-billion-a-year farm policy.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo and Selam Gebrekidan

articles.headline: America’s Dairy Farmers Are Hurting. A Giant Merger Could Make Things Worse.
articles.snippet: The largest dairy co-op in the United States is in talks to acquire Dean Foods, a milk processing company that sought bankruptcy protection last month.
articles.abstract: The largest dairy co-op in the United States is in talks to acquire Dean Foods, a milk processing company that sought bankruptcy protection last month.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOBART, N.Y. — John Lamport limped across the barn that once housed dozens of his cows, gesturing toward the vacant stalls lining the perimeter.

articles.headline: This Is What Racism Sounds Like in the Banking Industry
articles.snippet: A JPMorgan employee and a customer secretly recorded their conversations with bank employees.
articles.abstract: A JPMorgan employee and a customer secretly recorded their conversations with bank employees.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jimmy Kennedy earned $13 million during his nine-year career as a player in the National Football League. He was the kind of person most banks would be happy to have as a client.
